content.text:
# 9th TCA Awards

The 9th TCA Awards were presented by the Television Critics Association. The ceremony was held on July 23, 1993, at the Universal City Hilton and Towers in Los Angeles, Calif.
Winners and nominees
{| class="wikitable"
|-
!width="260"|Category
!width="380"|Winner
!width="440"|Other Nominees
|-
|align="center" style="background: #ececec; color: grey; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;" class="table-na" | Program of the Year
|align="center" | Barbarians at the Gate (HBO)
|
* Cheers (NBC)
* Homicide: Life on the Street (NBC)
* Seinfeld (NBC)
* The Simpsons (Fox)
|-
|align="center" style="background: #ececec; color: grey; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;" class="table-na" | Outstanding Achievement in Comedy
|align="center" | Seinfeld (NBC)
|
* Cheers (NBC)
* The Larry Sanders Show (HBO)
* Roseanne (ABC)
* The Simpsons (Fox)
|-
|align="center" style="background: #ececec; color: grey; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;" class="table-na" | Outstanding Achievement in Drama
|align="center" | ''I'll Fly Away (NBC)
|
* Barbarians at the Gate (HBO)
* Homefront (ABC)
* Homicide: Life on the Street (NBC)
* Law & Order (NBC)
* Prime Suspect 2 (PBS)
|-

|
* Michael Jackson Talks... to Oprah: 90 Primetime Minutes with the King of Pop (ABC)
* Rowan & Martin's Laugh-In: 25th Anniversary Reunion (NBC)
* Women of Country'' (CBS)
|-
|align="center" style="background: #ececec; color: grey; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;" class="table-na" | Outstanding Achievement in Children's Programming
|align="center" | Linda Ellerbee (Nickelodeon)
|

|align="center" style="background: #ececec; color: grey; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;" class="table-na" | Outstanding Achievement in News and Information
|align="center" | Frontline (PBS)
|

|align="center" | Bob Hope

* Roone Arledge
* David Letterman

* Fred Rogers
|}
